meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of a duct
meanings.sent1: The ductal system in the building helps to circulate air efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The plumber fixed the ductal pipe that was leaking water.
meanings.sent3: The ductal ducks waddled in a straight line, mimicking the shape of a pipe.
meanings.sent4: Her voice flowed smoothly through the ductal passages of the old theater.
meanings.sent5: The ductal design of the tunnel allowed for easy passage of vehicles.

meanings.definition: pertaining to a duct or ducts
meanings.sent1: The ductal system in the house kept the rooms warm during winter.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully examined the ductal structure before the operation.
meanings.sent3: The ductal delivery of the package was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts followed a ductal path, leading to a clear solution.
meanings.sent5: The ductal network of veins carried nutrients throughout the plant.

meanings.definition: of or relating to a duct or ducts
meanings.sent1: The ductal connection between the two rooms allowed for easy access.
meanings.sent2: The ductal system of the building needed regular maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The ductal traffic flow in the city was surprisingly smooth.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas followed a ductal route, connecting different concepts seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The ductal design of the irrigation system ensured even distribution of water.
